comment: Professor Burch was amazing. This class was a breeze as long as you study the material, do the work on time, and put in the effort you'll get an A. Workload isn't heavy at all, 3 exams, 3 quizzes, and 4 writing assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took him for a four-week online course over the summer, really easy. The only thing I had difficulty with in the beginning was adding more sentences to the weekly writing assignments, but once I fixed that I started making 100's on them, so it wasn't a big deal! He gives really good feedback, I definitely recommend him!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Takes off for absences and for being tardy. Hes a tough grader but approves designs ahead of time and is extremely helpful with everything. Had him for sculpture 1 and any ideas you have he will help you create no matter how bizarre. Very knowledgeable and understanding. You pay a lot to be in art school and will get your money worth with him
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Just follow the rubric and go over the powerpoints before the exams and you will pass. Writing assignments are easy, but follow the rubric to receive a good grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Best Professor out there. His class is super easy! He gives feedback on all assignments. There are five art writing assignments (super easy), 3 quizzes, and 3 exams. Not a tough grader. If you need to reach him, he responds to emails quickly. I recommend taking this class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Open book/notes quizzes and tests. The book is not required. PS, the test and quiz answers are easy to find (Use Socratic lol). There is no webcam but there is a lockdown browser. Easiest A you can possibly receive. I only showed up to class 3 times, and tbh,don't attend the lecture. Complete waste of time. You don't need to study for this class
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Test and Quizzes are open book/notes. Textbook is not required. PS, the test and quiz answers are easy to find (Use Socratic lol). There is no webcam but there is a lockdown browser. Easiest A you can possibly receive. I only showed up to class 3 times, and tbh,don't attend the lecture. Complete waste of time. You don't need to study for this class
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Burch is a very laid back guy. Easy A, easy assignments. Every other week you have to write short opinion pieces on artwork in the PowerPoints and take easy quizzes. He comments on each assignment which is cool. Tests have 50+ questions but aren't hard if you review the PPTs. The textbook is not needed at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: There is one group project. I did it with four other people and only me and one girl did the entire project. I emailed him about it, but he didn't give the other people a grade according to that, which I didn't think was fair because they never helped us. Other than that, he is a very easy and straightforward teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Burch was great to take for the credit. Tests and quizzes are few, but easy if you pay attention. Sometimes youll have to write an opinion on pieces of art from the presentations. He really cares about your perspective. Overall a great professor who gives good feedback. Hes a cool dude.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor. Textbook not required. Hardly any work and grades easily. Really cares about his students. Clear due dates. Easy quizzes as long as you kind of study his power points. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Can't really go wrong with this guy. 4 tests and 4 quizzes. Memorize what he tells you to and study for the tests and his class is a breeze. Also have a group project that wasn't so bad. Super chill and honest.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Easiest art class ever. You need to memorize a few things for exams (there's four), he posts the powerpoints before class, so you won't be affected if you don't show up as long as you study them.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Burch is an awesome professor. He is very laid back, and really wants his students to succeed. The content he teaches is fun and he always keeps it interesting.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Burch is a great choice for Art in Society, he has three pop quizzes per unit which might deter some people but they are great grade boosters and usually fairly predictable. They are also over the lecture that day. His tests also seems scary but they are very easy as long as you study the day before.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor is mediocre- not horrible but not one that I would want to take again. His tests are relatively easy if you study for them. I would have gotten an A except that he gives three 5 question pop quizzes randomly through the semester that are 20% of your grade. Missing one or even getting a 60 can really bring your grade down.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Show up to class. There are three pop quizzes, tests are pretty straight forward if you study his powerpoints, which are posted on d2l. One group presentaion, pretty simple, and one paper you write after visiting an art museum. Prof Burch is helpful and will fix grading errors if they are brought to his attention. Really go to class though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Burch is a good professor in terms of his understanding of students. Textbook is not required because his powerpoints are virtually verbatim. Attendance isnt mandatory, but there are three pop quizzes. I missed two of those which ended up landing me with a B. Tests are usually 20 identification paintings and 30 multiple choice questions.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Wasn't excited to take this class, but professor Burch made it really interesting with his lectures. I left the class with a new respect for art. 3 tests, last one being the final, NON CUMULATIVE, 3 pop quizzes so it's better to show up to class, 1 presentation. It's an easy A, I wish he would teach other classes, he's hilarious and a solid choice
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Probably my favorite art class to date. Page has easily become my favorite teacher here at KSU and I highly recommend him always. Assignments were always interesting and he lets the class have fun while working. Wish I could take him again!
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Professor Burch genuinely makes looking at the "hows" and "whys" of art very interesting. He makes you think about things in new lights. He is a very good speaker, his PowerPoints are very professional and well-done, and he is an overall nice guy. I left the class with a new respect for all artists.

Didn't realize that this class was an easy A until later on. 3 pop quizzes so make sure you show up & pay attention on lecture days. Missed a few of non lecture classes. The day i missed class was when he gave extra credit -_- lol. Tests are easy as long as you get the key things in the powerpoint. He's funny. Recommend that you pay attention

This is a straight-forward gen-ed art class. He'll tell you to buy the book, but if you can find an earlier version online for free, you don't need to pay hundreds for a new one. There was one paper, one presentation, three exams, and some pop-quizzes. Go to class and study for the exams and this is an easy A.
Passionate teacher. Wants everyone to pass but if you don't come you don't have a chance. Handsome, funny, but intimidating at first. Would take him again because I learned A LOT.

He's young, very helpful. Responds to emails quickly  and tries his best to help you out. His exams are a bit hard but if you study you pass. He has pop quizzes which is on his lecture of the day. You have to visit a museum. There is a 5 min presentation. Overall, if you study and attend class, you'll pass. Definitely would take him again.

he is very young and we were his first class ever, lectures were long and a bit boring, "pop up quizzes" every other class, one 5 minute Power Point presentation, quizzes are on the chapters in the book, the Professot is very easy going and helpful
